name: K2-32
scenarioDescription:
The K2-32 Exoplanetary System

K2-32 is a star with 0.86 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.84 times its radius. It is located 516.60 light years away from the solar system.

K2-32 is known to have 4 exoplanets in orbit around it.

K2-32 b

K2-32 b was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.08 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 8.99 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, K2-32.

The mass of K2-32 b is 45.03 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-32 b is 4.96 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, K2-32 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

K2-32 d

K2-32 d was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.19 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 31.71 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, K2-32.

The mass of K2-32 d is 16.56 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-32 d is 3.27 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, K2-32 d is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

K2-32 c

K2-32 c was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.14 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 20.66 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, K2-32.

The mass of K2-32 c is 10.76 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-32 c is 2.74 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, K2-32 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

K2-32 e

K2-32 e was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2019-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 4.35 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, K2-32.

The mass of K2-32 e is 0.98 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-32 e is 1.01 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, K2-32 e is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-32, which contains 4 planets and was discovered by K2.
